title.narrative: SEMIARID PLATFORM

description.narrative: By the end of 2016, the States and Municipalities of the Semiarid Region committed to reducing child rights and gender and racial related inequities and ensuring CRC compliance to contribute with the improvement of their social indicators for children and adolescents thus addressing inequities in Brazil., which contributes to Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, governments at national and sub-national levels, media, corporate sector and civil society with increased capacities and knowledge on the most disadvantaged children, contributing to the universalization of Child Rights, supporting specific public policies addressing inequities and prioritizing boys and girls in public budgets.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2016, the States and Municipalities of the Semiarid Region committed to reducing child rights and gender and racialrelated inequities and ensuring CRC compliance to contribute with the improvement of their social indicators for children andadolescents thus addressing inequities in Brazil.

description.narrative: UNICEF advances guarantee of rights of children and adolescents with 1,134 municipalities in the Semiarid Region of Brazil in the areas of education, survival and development, protection, and adolescent participation, and awarding UNICEF Municipal Seal of Approval to 308 municipalities and giving special mention to an additional 597. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: By the end of 2012, 50% of all municipalities of the Semiarid Region participating in all the phases of the UNICEF Seal 2009-2012, including the two forums and the social participation themes.

actual.value: 2016:Target achieved51% of all municipalities of the Semiarid Region enrolled and participated in all the phases of the UNICEF Seal 2009-2012, including the two forums and the social participation themes.

title.narrative: By the end of 2012, 15% of all municipalities of the Semiarid Region being recognized with the UNICEF Municipal Seal of Approval Edition 2009-2012.

actual.value: 2016:Target achieved22% of all municipalities of the Semiarid Region enrolled were recognized with the UNICEF Municipal Seal of Approval – Edition 2009-2012.

title.narrative: By the end of 2013, 60% of all municipalities of the Semi-Arid Region enrolling in UNICEF Seal, Edition 2013 - 2016

actual.value: 2016:Target achieved.76% of all municipalities of the Semiarid Region enrolled in UNICEF Seal, Edition 2013 – 2016.

title.narrative: By the end of 2016,Percentage of all municipalities of the Semiarid Region being recognized with the UNICEF Municipal Seal of Approval Edition 2013-2016

actual.value: 2016:Target achievedBy the end of 2016, 27% (308) of all municipalities of the Semiarid Region being recognized with the UNICEF Municipal Seal of Approval – Edition 2013-2016

title.narrative: Percentage of all municipalities of the Semiarid Region participating in all the phases of the UNICEF Seal, Edition 2013-2016, including the two forums and the creation of the Adolescent Citizenship Group

actual.value: 2016:53% (597 of 1,134 municipalities) participated in all phases of the UNICEF Seal, edition 2013 – 2016, including two forums and the creation of Adolescent Citizenship Group. This percentage is considered quite high considering the economic and political turmoil of the country during this period.

title.narrative: Political Pact based on gender equality, equity and CRC principles for boys, girls, adolescents rights established with all Governors of Semiarid Region

actual.value: 2016:Target achievedBy December 2016, pPolitical pacts were are in place in 90% of all states in SAB, focusing on one or more areas UNICEF programming
